# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Special Instructions

None.

To solve this task, I will use the following Julia snippets:
- `split` function to split the input string into words
- `join` function to join the words back together with new lines
- `foldl` function to iterate over the words and add new lines when the maximum text width is exceeded

I will define the `wrap_string` function to take in a string and an optional `text_width` parameter. The function will split the input string into words, iterate over the words, and add a new line when the maximum text width is exceeded. Finally, it will join the words back together with new lines and return the wrapped string.
